catalog_info.title: Cyberpolitics
catalog_info.description: This seminar examines how the digital age has transformed politics around the world, in democratic and authoritarian contexts. Information and communication technologies change how people, states, and non-state actors interact. Social media (Facebook, Twitter) facilitate information-sharing and collective action. Technology creates new access points and new vulnerabilities. The course includes four modules: e-Democracy (civic engagement, elections, accountability); Online Revolutions (resistance, repression, mobilization); Security (cyberwar, terrorism, hacking); and Beyond State Boundaries (international cooperation, diasporas, transnational activism).
